name: v3.2.0
body:
- New selector for the type of activity with a larger set of icons
- You can copy current coordinates to clipboard
- Accurate antennas now show the accuracy using one or two decimals
- GPX files contain the information on how the altitudes are calculated (EGM Correction and/or offset)
- Accuracies are exported with 2 decimals
- A cache management for temporary files
- Some fixes and improvements

name: v3.1.7
body: - Workaround for the issue with Organic Maps

name: v3.1.6
body: - Fixes the browser check for the Online Help on Android 11+

name: v3.1.5
body:
- Workaround for the issue of MAPS.ME v14 opening GPX files
- Update Android dependencies

name: v3.1.4
body:
- Add a quick annotation with a long click of the Annotation button
- The app is drivable with keyboard shortcuts for task automation
- Added Greek language
- Added a warning when the app is battery optimised
- Some improvements for Light Theme
- Fixes the alignment of Time fields on Android 4.0
- Fixes crash on devices without onboard GPS chipset
- Some minor bugs fixed

name: v3.1.3
body:
- You can select any speed unit regardless of the system of measurement
- Some minor improvements and adjustments
- Code cleanup and small bugs fixed

The Japanese language has been removed, as it is no longer maintained by any user.
This open source app is translated in many languages thanks to the precious collaboration of some willing users around the world. Anyone can freely help to translate and keep updated languages here: https://crowdin.com/project/gpslogger

name: v3.1.2
body:
- Some memory optimizations
- Bug fixing release

The Japanese language has been removed, as it is no longer maintained by any user.
This open source app is translated in many languages thanks to the precious collaboration of some willing users around the world. Anyone can freely help to translate and keep updated languages here: https://crowdin.com/project/gpslogger

name: v3.1.1
body:
- Fixes the View feature for Android 11+

- The Japanese language has been removed, as it is no longer maintained by any user.
This open source app is translated in many languages thanks to the precious collaboration of some willing users around the world. Anyone can freely help to translate and keep updated languages here: https://crowdin.com/project/gpslogger

name: v3.1.0
body:
- You can choose the local exportation folder
- Added a Time Interval Filter
- The Distance Filter can be set to any value
- Removed the permission to access the whole storage
- Some bugs fixed
- Small improvements all around

- The Japanese language has been removed, as it is no longer maintained by any user.
This open source app is translated in many languages thanks to the precious collaboration of some willing users around the world.
Anyone can freely help to translate and keep updated languages here: https://crowdin.com/project/gpslogger

name: v3.0.2
body:
- Added Russian language
- A couple of small refinements

name: v3.0.1
body:
- A new bottom bar, strongly inspired by audio recorders
- A Lock button that avoids accidental clicks
- Ability to add a description to tracks, that is used also to name the files
- Visualization of the number of satellites when the app is looking for GPS
- Improved the compatibility with external viewers
- A link to the online help
- Lots of small changes and improvements
- v3.0.1 fixes crash when deletes a track without thumbnail

name: v3.0.0
body:
- A new bottom bar, strongly inspired by audio recorders
- A Lock button that avoids accidental clicks
- Ability to add a description to tracks, that is used also to name the files
- Visualization of the number of satellites when the app is looking for GPS
- Improved the compatibility with external viewers
- A link to the online help
- Lots of small changes and improvements

name: v2.3.2
body:
- The Download of the EGM Grid has been restored, and now it works also on Android 4 Devices
- New App's Icon
- Some small graphical improvements

name: v2.3.1
body:
- You can select/deselect a Range of Tracks with long Click on Tracklist
- A couple of Bugs fixed

name: v2.3.0
body:
- Introduced a more informative Notification
- Added some Messages that help the Users with the Setup of the GPS Service
- Fixed the compatibility problems of GPX Files with Memory-Map and Geosetter
- The App now works in background also with the Location Permission "allowed only while the App is in Use" (Android 10+)
- Some Optimizations to reduce Battery Usage when the Screen is Off
- A good number of small Improvements

name: v2.2.10
body:
- You can show GPS Time in your local Timezone
- Fixed the Satellites Count on dual band GNSS Devices
- A Couple of small Improvements

name: v2.2.9
body: - Fixes the problem with Earth when it is the only Viewer installed

name: v2.2.8
body:
- Features consolidation
- Minor bugs fixed
- Some Refinements in Light Theme

name: v2.2.7
body:
- New Selector and Preference for external GPX/KML Viewer, independent of System Default Apps
- Added portuguese Language
- Earth works again as a Track Viewer
- Fixed a Bug that can cause possible Data Corruption on some Devices when the System shuts down during Recording
- A couple of small Bugs fixed
- Some Refinements in Light Theme

name: v2.2.6
body:
- Fixes the Sharing Feature on Android 10
- Some small Refinements

name: v2.2.5
body:
- Added a Light Theme for bright Environments
- GPS Fix Tab now shows also GPS Time and Satellites (when possible)
- Fixed a Bug that caused some Crashes on Motorola Android 9 Devices
- Some Layout Refinements for Cards

name: v2.2.4
body: - Fix wrong Timezone in Timestamps of GPX and TXT files

name: v2.2.3
body:
- High Frequency Recording (up to 20 Hz), thought for Bluetooth GPS Receivers
- Possibility to Shutdown the App without finalize the active Track
- You can resume the Recording of a Track after a Crash or a System Reboot
- Improved Exportation Speed
- Added hungarian and brazilian portuguese Languages
- Small Optimizations all around
- A couple of Bugs fixed

name: v2.2.2
body:
- Features consolidation
- Minor bugs fixed

name: v2.2.1
body: - A couple of Bugs fixed

name: v2.2.0
body:
- A new Tracklist, featuring improved Cards and multiple Selection
- GPS Timestamp Rollover Fix for old GPS Hardware
- Fix the download of the EGM Grid for Android 5+
- Added simplified chinese Language
- Small Enhancements and Optimizations all around
- Some Bugs fixed

name: v2.1.12
body:
- Special care of GPX files
- Some small enhancements
- A couple of bugs fixed

name: v2.1.11
body:
- A more polite behaviour of Service and Notification icon
- You can choose a KML or a GPX viewer to view your tracks
- Many optimizations and improvements for KML files
- Some small enhancements and a couple of bugs fixed

name: v2.1.10
body:
- Added support for GPX 1.1 (adding compatibility with Garmin Connect and many other third-party programs)
- You can choose the GPX version on Settings
- Added french language
- Some minor bugs fixed

name: v2.1.9
body:
- Fine tuning of Real-time Permissions
- Memory optimization for thumbnails (using Glide)
- Fix a crash on start in some devices

name: v2.1.8
body:
- Features consolidation
- Performance improvements
- Many minor bugs fixed

name: v2.1.7
body:
- Added Aerial / Nautical system of measurement
- Added german language
- EGM correction can be enabled without grant Storage permission
- You can delete the /GPSLogger folder without lose the EGM file

name: v2.1.6
body:
- Current active track is now visible on tracklist
- You can view, export and share the current active track
- Added italian language
- Various performance and memory optimizations
- Minor bugs fixed

name: v2.1.5
body:
- View your tracks using your preferred KML viewer
- Added spanish and japanese languages
- Many optimizations and small enhancements
- Minor bugs fixed

name: v2.1.4
body:
- Added exportation in TXT format (issue #12)
- Validation of GPX schema v1.0 (using the Xerces XML parser - https://xerces.apache.org/)
- Solved Compatibility issue with Garmin MapSource (issue #17)
- Several bugs fixed

name: v2.1.3
body:
- Changed the newline to Windows standard "\r\n" instead of "\n"
- Added encoding="UTF-8" in GPX file header
- DB upgrade to version 2: Satellites Used in FIX added to TrackPoints and Placemarks
- Added Satellites used in fix into GPX in trackpoints and Placemarks: i.e. \<sat\>8\</sat\>

name: v2.1.2
body:
- Switch to "SingleTask" activities in AndroidManifest.xml
- Switch default Altitude mode to "Projected To Ground"
- Notification brings to front the existing istance of the app
- Add the "Shutdown" menu item (issue #9)
- Shutdown process ask confirmation also if isRecording or isPlacemarkRequest and set them to zero
- Added message to ask to change Altitude Mode to Absolute on EGM file downloaded

name: v2.1.1
body: - SingleInstance mode for activity

name: v2.1.0
body:
- Added Foreground Service with notification icon, to keep app running in background
- HOME brings the app in background, keep running
- BACK closes the app (and terminates the Foreground Service), showing confirmation if needed
- Notification icon optimization for Android 5.1+
- SingleInstance mode for activity

name: v2.0.3
body:
- GPX and KML formatting optimization
- Added a double click (with toasts) on "Track Finished" button clicking
- Several bugs fixed

name: v2.0.2
body:
- Bug fixed in case of multiple runtime requests
- Added the SpikesChecker filter
- Added <uses-feature android:name="android.hardware.location.gps"/> to Manifest
- Export KML placemarks elevations according to settings

name: v2.0.1
body: - Bug fixed on GPX <time> tags; timestamps now are in UTC (following GPX 1.0 standard)

name: v2.0.0
body:
Application rewritten from scratch
- New Material User Interface
- Saves data into Database
- Track statistics
- Tracklist to view your recorded tracks
- Sharing of GPX and KML tracks
- View in Google Earth
- Exportation in /GPSLogger folder
